00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_int_base.h -- A signed integer whose length is less than 64 bit.
00023 
00024               Unlike arbitrary precision, arithmetic and bitwise operations
00025               are performed using the native types (hence capped at 64 bits).
00026               The sc_int integer is useful when the user does not need
00027               arbitrary precision and the performance is superior to
00028               sc_bigint/sc_biguint.
00029 
00030   Original Author: Amit Rao, Synopsys, Inc.
00031 
00032  *****************************************************************************/
00033 
00034 /*****************************************************************************
00035 
00036   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00037   changes you are making here.
00038 
00039       Name, Affiliation, Date: Ali Dasdan, Synopsys, Inc.
00040   Description of Modification: - Resolved ambiguity with sc_(un)signed.
00041                                - Merged the code for 64- and 32-bit versions
00042                                  via the constants in sc_nbdefs.h.
00043                                - Eliminated redundant file inclusions.
00044 
00045       Name, Affiliation, Date:
00046   Description of Modification:
00047 
00048  *****************************************************************************/
00049

00134 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00135 //  CLASS : sc_int_bitref_r
00136 //
00137 //  Proxy class for sc_int bit selection (r-value only).
00138 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00139 
00140 class SC_API sc_int_bitref_r : public sc_value_base
00141 {
00142     friend class sc_int_base;
00143 
00144 protected:
00145 
00146     // constructor
00147 
00148     sc_int_bitref_r() : sc_value_base(), m_index(), m_obj_p()
00149         {}
00150 
00151     // initializer for sc_core::sc_vpool:
00152 
00153     void initialize( const sc_int_base* obj_p, int index_ )
00154     {
00155         m_obj_p = (sc_int_base*)obj_p;
00156         m_index = index_;
00157     }
00158 
00159 public:
00160 
00161     // copy constructor
00162 
00163     sc_int_bitref_r( const sc_int_bitref_r& a ) :
00164         sc_value_base(a), m_index(a.m_index), m_obj_p(a.m_obj_p)
00165         {}
00166 
00167     // destructor
00168 
00169     virtual ~sc_int_bitref_r()
00170         {}
00171 
00172     // capacity
00173 
00174     int length() const
00175         { return 1; }
00176 
00177 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
00178     int bitwidth() const
00179         { return length(); }
00180 #endif
00181 
00182     // concatenation support
00183 
00184     virtual int concat_length( bool *xz_present_p ) const
00185         { if (xz_present_p) *xz_present_p = false; return 1; }
00186     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00187         {
00188             int bit_mask = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00189             int word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00190 
00191             dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit_mask;
00192             return false;
00193         }
00194     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00195         {
00196             bool non_zero;
00197             int bit_mask = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00198             int word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00199 
00200             if ( operator uint64() )
00201             {
00202                 dst_p[word_i] |= bit_mask;
00203                 non_zero = true;
00204             }
00205             else
00206             {
00207                 dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit_mask;
00208                 non_zero = false;
00209             }
00210             return non_zero;
00211         }
00212     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00213         { return operator uint64(); }
00214 
00215 
00216 
00217 
00218     // implicit conversions
00219 
00220     operator uint64 () const;
00221     bool operator ! () const;
00222     bool operator ~ () const;
00223 
00224 
00225     // explicit conversions
00226 
00227     uint64 value() const
00228         { return operator uint64(); }
00229 
00230     bool to_bool() const
00231         { return operator uint64(); }
00232 
00233 
00234     // other methods
00235 
00236     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00237         { os << to_bool(); }
00238 
00239 protected:
00240     int          m_index;
00241     sc_int_base* m_obj_p;
00242 
00243 private:
00244 
00245     // disabled
00246     sc_int_bitref_r& operator = ( const sc_int_bitref_r& );
00247 };
00248 
00249 
00250 inline
00251 ::std::ostream&
00252 operator << ( ::std::ostream&, const sc_int_bitref_r& );
00253

00321 class SC_API sc_int_subref_r : public sc_value_base
00322 {
00323     friend class sc_int_base;
00324     friend class sc_int_signal;
00325     friend class sc_int_subref;
00326 
00327 protected:
00328 
00329     // constructor
00330 
00331     sc_int_subref_r() : sc_value_base(), m_left(0), m_obj_p(0), m_right(0)
00332         {}
00333 
00334     // initializer for sc_core::sc_vpool:
00335 
00336     void initialize( const sc_int_base* obj_p, int left_i, int right_i )
00337     {
00338         m_obj_p = (sc_int_base*)obj_p;
00339         m_left = left_i;
00340         m_right = right_i;
00341     }
00342 
00343 
00344 public:
00345     // copy constructor
00346 
00347     sc_int_subref_r( const sc_int_subref_r& a ) :
00348         sc_value_base(a), m_left( a.m_left ), m_obj_p( a.m_obj_p ),
00349         m_right( a.m_right )
00350         {}
00351 
00352     // destructor
00353 
00354     virtual ~sc_int_subref_r()
00355         {}
00356 
00357     // capacity
00358 
00359     int length() const
00360         { return ( m_left - m_right + 1 ); }
00361 
00362 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
00363     int bitwidth() const
00364         { return length(); }
00365 #endif
00366 
00367     // concatenation support
00368 
00369     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00370         { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return length(); }
00371     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00372     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00373     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00374     {
00375         int    len = length();
00376         uint64 val = operator uint_type();
00377         if ( len < 64 )
00378             return (uint64)(val & ~((uint_type)-1 << len));
00379         else
00380             return (uint64)val;
00381     }
00382 
00383     // reduce methods
00384 
00385     bool and_reduce() const;
00386 
00387     bool nand_reduce() const
00388         { return ( ! and_reduce() ); }
00389 
00390     bool or_reduce() const;
00391 
00392     bool nor_reduce() const
00393         { return ( ! or_reduce() ); }
00394 
00395     bool xor_reduce() const;
00396 
00397     bool xnor_reduce() const
00398         { return ( ! xor_reduce() ); }
00399 
00400 
00401     // implicit conversion to uint_type
00402 
00403     operator uint_type () const;
00404 
00405 
00406     // explicit conversions
00407 
00408     uint_type value() const
00409         { return operator uint_type(); }
00410 
00411 
00412     int           to_int() const;
00413     unsigned int  to_uint() const;
00414     long          to_long() const;
00415     unsigned long to_ulong() const;
00416     int64         to_int64() const;
00417     uint64        to_uint64() const;
00418     double        to_double() const;
00419 
00420 
00421     // explicit conversion to character string
00422 
00423     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep = SC_DEC ) const;
00424     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep, bool w_prefix ) const;
00425 
00426 
00427     // other methods
00428 
00429     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00430         { os << to_string(sc_io_base(os,SC_DEC),sc_io_show_base(os)); }
00431 
00432 protected:
00433 
00434     int          m_left;
00435     sc_int_base* m_obj_p;
00436     int          m_right;
00437 
00438 private:
00439     const sc_int_subref_r& operator = ( const sc_int_subref_r& );
00440 };
00441

00445 ::std::ostream&
00446 operator << ( ::std::ostream&, const sc_int_subref_r& );

00538 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00539 //  CLASS : sc_int_base
00540 //
00541 //  Base class for sc_int.
00542 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00543 
00544 class SC_API sc_int_base : public sc_value_base
00545 {
00546     friend class sc_int_bitref_r;
00547     friend class sc_int_bitref;
00548     friend class sc_int_subref_r;
00549     friend class sc_int_subref;
00550 
00551 
00552     // support methods
00553 
00554     void invalid_length() const;
00555     void invalid_index( int i ) const;
00556     void invalid_range( int l, int r ) const;
00557 
00558     void check_length() const
00559         { if( m_len <= 0 || m_len > SC_INTWIDTH ) { invalid_length(); } }
00560 
00561     void check_index( int i ) const
00562         { if( i < 0 || i >= m_len ) { invalid_index( i ); } }
00563 
00564     void check_range( int l, int r ) const
00565         { if( r < 0 || l >= m_len || l < r ) { invalid_range( l, r ); } }
00566 
00567     void check_value() const;
00568 
00569     void extend_sign()
00570         {
00571 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00572             check_value();
00573 #endif
00574             m_val = ( m_val << m_ulen >> m_ulen );
00575         }
00576 
00577 public:
00578 
00579     // constructors
00580 
00581     explicit sc_int_base( int w = sc_length_param().len() )
00582         : m_val( 0 ), m_len( w ), m_ulen( SC_INTWIDTH - m_len )
00583         { check_length(); }
00584 
00585     sc_int_base( int_type v, int w )
00586         : m_val( v ), m_len( w ), m_ulen( SC_INTWIDTH - m_len )
00587         { check_length(); extend_sign(); }
00588 
00589     sc_int_base( const sc_int_base& a )
00590         : sc_value_base(a), m_val( a.m_val ), m_len( a.m_len ),
00591           m_ulen( a.m_ulen )
00592         {}
00593 
00594     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_int_subref_r& a )
00595         : m_val( a ), m_len( a.length() ), m_ulen( SC_INTWIDTH - m_len )
00596         { extend_sign(); }
00597 
00598     template< class T >
00599     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_generic_base<T>& a ) :
00600         m_val( a->to_int64() ), m_len( a->length() ),
00601         m_ulen( SC_INTWIDTH - m_len )
00602         { check_length(); extend_sign(); }
00603 
00604     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_signed& a );
00605     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_unsigned& a );
00606     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_bv_base& v );
00607     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_lv_base& v );
00608     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_uint_subref_r& v );
00609     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_signed_subref_r& v );
00610     explicit sc_int_base( const sc_unsigned_subref_r& v );
00611 
00612 
00613 
00614     // destructor
00615 
00616     virtual ~sc_int_base()
00617         {}
00618 
00619     // assignment operators
00620 
00621     sc_int_base& operator = ( int_type v )
00622         { m_val = v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00623 
00624     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_int_base& a )
00625         { m_val = a.m_val; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00626 
00627     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_int_subref_r& a )
00628         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00629 
00630     template<class T>
00631     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
00632         { m_val = a->to_int64(); extend_sign(); return *this; }
00633 
00634     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_signed& a );
00635     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_unsigned& a );
00636 
00637 #ifdef SC_INCLUDE_FX
00638     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_fxval& a );
00639     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_fxval_fast& a );
00640     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_fxnum& a );
00641     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_fxnum_fast& a );
00642 #endif
00643 
00644     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_bv_base& a );
00645     sc_int_base& operator = ( const sc_lv_base& a );
00646 
00647     sc_int_base& operator = ( const char* a );
00648 
00649     sc_int_base& operator = ( unsigned long a )
00650         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00651 
00652     sc_int_base& operator = ( long a )
00653         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00654 
00655     sc_int_base& operator = ( unsigned int a )
00656         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00657 
00658     sc_int_base& operator = ( int a )
00659         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00660 
00661     sc_int_base& operator = ( uint64 a )
00662         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00663 
00664     sc_int_base& operator = ( double a )
00665         { m_val = (int_type) a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00666 
00667 
00668     // arithmetic assignment operators
00669 
00670     sc_int_base& operator += ( int_type v )
00671         { m_val += v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00672 
00673     sc_int_base& operator -= ( int_type v )
00674         { m_val -= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00675 
00676     sc_int_base& operator *= ( int_type v )
00677         { m_val *= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00678 
00679     sc_int_base& operator /= ( int_type v )
00680         { m_val /= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00681 
00682     sc_int_base& operator %= ( int_type v )
00683         { m_val %= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00684 
00685 
00686     // bitwise assignment operators
00687 
00688     sc_int_base& operator &= ( int_type v )
00689         { m_val &= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00690 
00691     sc_int_base& operator |= ( int_type v )
00692         { m_val |= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00693 
00694     sc_int_base& operator ^= ( int_type v )
00695         { m_val ^= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00696 
00697 
00698     sc_int_base& operator <<= ( int_type v )
00699         { m_val <<= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00700 
00701     sc_int_base& operator >>= ( int_type v )
00702         { m_val >>= v; /* no sign extension needed */ return *this; }
00703 
00704 
00705     // prefix and postfix increment and decrement operators
00706 
00707     sc_int_base& operator ++ () // prefix
00708         { ++ m_val; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00709 
00710     const sc_int_base operator ++ ( int ) // postfix
00711         { sc_int_base tmp( *this ); ++ m_val; extend_sign(); return tmp; }
00712 
00713     sc_int_base& operator -- () // prefix
00714         { -- m_val; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00715 
00716     const sc_int_base operator -- ( int ) // postfix
00717         { sc_int_base tmp( *this ); -- m_val; extend_sign(); return tmp; }
00718 
00719 
00720     // relational operators
00721 
00722     friend bool operator == ( const sc_int_base& a, const sc_int_base& b )
00723         { return a.m_val == b.m_val; }
00724 
00725     friend bool operator != ( const sc_int_base& a, const sc_int_base& b )
00726         { return a.m_val != b.m_val; }
00727 
00728     friend bool operator <  ( const sc_int_base& a, const sc_int_base& b )
00729         { return a.m_val < b.m_val; }
00730 
00731     friend bool operator <= ( const sc_int_base& a, const sc_int_base& b )
00732         { return a.m_val <= b.m_val; }
00733 
00734     friend bool operator >  ( const sc_int_base& a, const sc_int_base& b )
00735         { return a.m_val > b.m_val; }
00736 
00737     friend bool operator >= ( const sc_int_base& a, const sc_int_base& b )
00738         { return a.m_val >= b.m_val; }
00739 
00740 
00741     // bit selection
00742 
00743     sc_int_bitref&         operator [] ( int i );
00744     const sc_int_bitref_r& operator [] ( int i ) const;
00745 
00746     sc_int_bitref&         bit( int i );
00747     const sc_int_bitref_r& bit( int i ) const;
00748 
00749 
00750     // part selection
00751 
00752     sc_int_subref&         operator () ( int left, int right );
00753     const sc_int_subref_r& operator () ( int left, int right ) const;
00754 
00755     sc_int_subref&         range( int left, int right );
00756     const sc_int_subref_r& range( int left, int right ) const;
00757 
00758 
00759     // bit access, without bounds checking or sign extension
00760 
00761     bool test( int i ) const
00762         { return ( 0 != (m_val & (UINT_ONE << i)) ); }
00763 
00764     void set( int i )
00765         { m_val |= (UINT_ONE << i); }
00766 
00767     void set( int i, bool v )
00768         { v ? m_val |= (UINT_ONE << i) : m_val &= ~(UINT_ONE << i); }
00769 
00770 
00771     // capacity
00772 
00773     int length() const
00774         { return m_len; }
00775 
00776 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
00777     int bitwidth() const
00778         { return length(); }
00779 #endif
00780 
00781     // concatenation support
00782 
00783     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00784         { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return length(); }
00785     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00786     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00787     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00788         {
00789             if ( m_len < 64 )
00790                 return (uint64)(m_val & ~((uint_type)-1 << m_len));
00791             else
00792                 return (uint64)m_val;
00793         }
00794     virtual void concat_set(int64 src, int low_i);
00795     virtual void concat_set(const sc_signed& src, int low_i);
00796     virtual void concat_set(const sc_unsigned& src, int low_i);
00797     virtual void concat_set(uint64 src, int low_i);
00798 
00799 
00800     // reduce methods
00801 
00802     bool and_reduce() const;
00803 
00804     bool nand_reduce() const
00805         { return ( ! and_reduce() ); }
00806 
00807     bool or_reduce() const;
00808 
00809     bool nor_reduce() const
00810         { return ( ! or_reduce() ); }
00811 
00812     bool xor_reduce() const;
00813 
00814     bool xnor_reduce() const
00815         { return ( ! xor_reduce() ); }
00816 
00817 
00818     // implicit conversion to int_type
00819 
00820     operator int_type() const
00821         { return m_val; }
00822 
00823 
00824     // explicit conversions
00825 
00826     int_type value() const
00827         { return operator int_type(); }
00828 
00829 
00830     int to_int() const
00831         { return (int) m_val; }
00832 
00833     unsigned int to_uint() const
00834         { return (unsigned int) m_val; }
00835 
00836     long to_long() const
00837         { return (long) m_val; }
00838 
00839     unsigned long to_ulong() const
00840         { return (unsigned long) m_val; }
00841 
00842     int64 to_int64() const
00843         { return (int64) m_val; }
00844 
00845     uint64 to_uint64() const
00846         { return (uint64) m_val; }
00847 
00848     double to_double() const
00849         { return (double) m_val; }
00850 
00851 
00852     long long_low() const
00853         { return (long) (m_val & UINT64_32ONES); }
00854 
00855     long long_high() const
00856         { return (long) ((m_val >> 32) & UINT64_32ONES); }
00857 
00858 
00859     // explicit conversion to character string
00860 
00861     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep = SC_DEC ) const;
00862     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep, bool w_prefix ) const;
00863 
00864 
00865     // other methods
00866 
00867     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00868         { os << to_string(sc_io_base(os,SC_DEC),sc_io_show_base(os)); }
00869 
00870     void scan( ::std::istream& is = ::std::cin );
00871 
00872 protected:
00873 
00874     int_type m_val;   // value
00875     int      m_len;   // length
00876     int      m_ulen;  // unused length
00877 };

00899 inline
00900 sc_int_bitref_r::operator uint64 () const
00901 {
00902     return m_obj_p->test( m_index );
00903 }

00906 bool
00907 sc_int_bitref_r::operator ! () const
00908 {
00909     return ! m_obj_p->test( m_index );
00910 }
00911 
00912 inline
00913 bool
00914 sc_int_bitref_r::operator ~ () const
00915 {
00916     return ! m_obj_p->test( m_index );
00917 }

00939 sc_int_bitref&
00940 sc_int_bitref::operator = ( const sc_int_bitref_r& b )
00941 {
00942     m_obj_p->set( m_index, (bool) b );
00943     m_obj_p->extend_sign();
00944     return *this;

00949 sc_int_bitref::operator = ( const sc_int_bitref& b )

00952     m_obj_p->extend_sign();
00953     return *this;
00954 }
00955 
00956 inline
00957 sc_int_bitref&
00958 sc_int_bitref::operator = ( bool b )
00959 {
00960     m_obj_p->set( m_index, b );
00961     m_obj_p->extend_sign();
00962     return *this;
00963 }
00964 
00965 
00966 inline
00967 sc_int_bitref&
00968 sc_int_bitref::operator &= ( bool b )
00969 {
00970     if( ! b ) {
00971         m_obj_p->set( m_index, b );
00972         m_obj_p->extend_sign();
00973     }
00974     return *this;
00975 }
00976 
00977 inline
00978 sc_int_bitref&
00979 sc_int_bitref::operator |= ( bool b )
00980 {
00981     if( b ) {
00982         m_obj_p->set( m_index, b );
00983         m_obj_p->extend_sign();
00984     }
00985     return *this;
00986 }
00987 
00988 inline
00989 sc_int_bitref&
00990 sc_int_bitref::operator ^= ( bool b )
00991 {
00992     if( b ) {
00993         m_obj_p->m_val ^= (UINT_ONE << m_index);
00994         m_obj_p->extend_sign();
00995     }
00996     return *this;
00997 }

01013 //  Proxy class for sc_int part selection (r-value only).

01015 
01016 // implicit conversion to int_type
01017 
01018 inline
01019 sc_int_subref_r::operator uint_type() const
01020 {
01021     uint_type /*int_type*/ val = m_obj_p->m_val;
01022     int uleft = SC_INTWIDTH - (m_left + 1);
01023     int uright = uleft + m_right;
01024     return ( val << uleft >> uright );
01025 }
01026

01232 inline
01233 sc_int_bitref&
01234 sc_int_base::operator [] ( int i )
01235 {
01236     check_index( i );
01237     sc_int_bitref* result_p = sc_int_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01238     result_p->initialize(this, i);
01239     return *result_p;
01240 }

01250 }
